amendment.description: Amendments prohibit the use of funds appropriated in the bill from being provided to any institution of higher education that prevents ROTC access to, or military recruiting on, its campus; and further prohibit expenditures to any contractor subject to the requirement in section 4212(d) of title 38, United States Code, that has not submitted an annual report to the Secretary of Labor concerning the employment of veterans.
amendment.purpose: An amendment consisting of two amendments offered in bloc to prohibit the use of funds appropriated in the bill to be used for contracts or grants to any institution of higher education that prohibts ROTC or restricts military recruiters from their campus; and to prohibit any funds from being used to enter into contractual agreements with businesses that do not comply with the reporting requirements regarding veterans hiring practices.

action.text: On agreeing to the Solomon amendments (A004) Agreed to by voice vote.
